1.text: I made a covenant with my eyes; why then should I think on a maid?

2.text: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

3.text: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

4.text: Does not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

5.text: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot has hurried to deceit;

6.text: Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know my integrity.

7.text: If my step has turned out of the way, and my heart walked after my eyes, and if any blot has stuck to my hands;

8.text: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yes, let my offspring be rooted out.

9.text: If my heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbor’s door;

10.text: Then let my wife grind to another, and let others bow down on her.

11.text: For this is an heinous crime; yes, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

12.text: For it is a fire that consumes to destruction, and would root out all my increase.

13.text: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

14.text: What then shall I do when God rises up? and when he visits, what shall I answer him?

15.text: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

16.text: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

17.text: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless has not eaten thereof;

18.text: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)

19.text: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

20.text: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

21.text: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

22.text: Then let my arm fall from my shoulder blade, and my arm be broken from the bone.

23.text: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

24.text: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, You are my confidence;

25.text: If I rejoice because my wealth was great, and because my hand had gotten much;

26.text: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

27.text: And my heart has been secretly enticed, or my mouth has kissed my hand:

28.text: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

29.text: If I rejoice at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

30.text: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

31.text: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

32.text: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the travelers.

33.text: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding my iniquity in my bosom:

34.text: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

35.text: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that my adversary had written a book.

36.text: Surely I would take it on my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

37.text: I would declare to him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near to him.

38.text: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

39.text: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

40.text: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
